Edit the default department settings or make/edit a variation for a specific department.

round_clock_in.description: Publish the schedules given x days ahead of current date

round_clock_out.description: How the clock out time should be rounded according to the timesheet interval setting

timesheet_copy_starttime.description: If an employee clocks in later than the given time before the start of her shift, copy the starttime from their shift.\n\nValue is minutes.

timesheet_copy_endtime.description: If an employee clocks out earlier than the given time after the end of her shift, copy the endtime from their shift.\n\nValue is minutes.

approve_clock.description: `Always`: Always automatically approve.\n`RosterMatch`: Approve clock times when start/end times match the employee's schedule\n`Never`: Never automatically approve.

default_clock_shift.description: When a clock-in action does not match a scheduled shift, it falls back to this Shift ID

allow_clock_in_without_roster.description: Clock always, even if you are not on the schedule.

timesheet_break_calculation.description:
This determines how breaks are calculated.

`None`: No break calculation, this must be entered manually.

`Automatic`: If the times correspond to the schedule, the break is taken from the schedule.

`Copy_from_schedule`: By default, the break is taken over from the work schedule in the timesheet.

`Clocked_or_copy_from_schedule_highest`: If more break is clocked than is specified in the scheduled shift, then the clocked break will be recorded.

`Break_rules`: Here, the break rules are always used to calculate and then record breaks.

`Clocked_or_break_rules_highest`: If more break has been clocked than has been calculated according to the break rules, then the clocked break will be recorded.

`Clocked`: Employees are hereby required to clock their breaks. The clocked breaks will be subtracted from the total work time.

round_break_shift.description: How should the start and end times be rounded for break shifts (Break shift: 2 shifts with less than an hour between the end of the first and start of the second). In other cases the normal clock roundings wil be applied

parameters.description: Enum for a part of department settings

put.description:
| Minimum plan | Required permission(s)
-------|------------
| `free` | `Manage account`

This API endpoint allows you to edit the default settings for a department or make/edit a variation for a specific department. The department settings are organized into different sections which correspond to the different aspects of department management. The section parameter specifies which section of the department settings to edit.

An enum that specifies which section of the department settings to edit. Valid values include: 
```
schedule_departments
schedule_availability
timesheet
timesheet_clocking
timesheet_breaks
notifications_employees
notifications_timetracking
notifications_schedule
```

get.description:
| Minimum plan | Required permission(s)
---------|----------
| `free` | `Add schedules`, `Edit schedules` 

The planning employability endpoint can be used to gain insight into which employees can and cannot be employed for the newly to be created shift during a given period. Based on the permissions of the user making the request one or more detailed reasons will be given besides the employability status as well as the total cost that would incur.

Depending on your plan, some checks may be skipped.  Premium is required for the conflicting skills check.  Starter is required for the Absence and Availability checks.

(Un)employability is determined based on the following criteria:
- `Absence`: Is the employee on leave during the specified period?
- `Schedule`: Is the employee already scheduled for another shift overlapping with the specified period?
- `Skills`: Does the employee have all the skills required to work the planned shift?
- `Availability`: Is the employee available for work according to his/her availability?

parameters.name: shiftId
parameters.description: Shift ID to use for selecting potential employees and skill requirements

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start of period to check, defaults to current time

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End of period to check, defaults to current time. Can be at most 23:59:59 after "from"

get.description:
| Minimum plan | Required permission(s)
---------|----------
| `free` | `Add schedules`, `Edit schedules` 

The shift employability endpoint can be used to gain insight into which employees can and cannot be employed for a specific shift type during a given period. Based on the permissions of the user making the request one or more detailed reasons will be given besides the employability status as well as the total cost that would incur.

Depending on your plan, some checks may be skipped.  Premium is required for the conflicting skills check.  Starter is required for the Absence and Availability checks.

(Un)employability is determined based on the following criteria:
- `Absence`: Is the employee on leave during the specified period
- `Schedule`: Is the employee already scheduled for another shift overlapping with the specified period
- `Skills`: Does the employee have all the skills required to work the requested shift type
- `Availability`: Is the employee available for work according to his/her availability

get.description:
| Minimum plan | Required permission(s)
---------|----------
| `starter` | `View reports`

With this endpoint, the result of a report can be fetched or downloaded. With the `format` query parameter the format of the response can be set.

#### Formats

##### raw
The raw format returns a JSON document with column info and rows.

##### json
The JSON format is a simpler format with an array with key-value objects, the key is the column name.

##### csv
In the CSV format, the value is separated with comma. The first row contains the column names.

##### xlsx
The xlsx format contains the same data as the csv, but can be openend with Excel.

AbsencePolicy.title: AbsencePolicy
AbsencePolicy.description: An `AbsencePolicy` is a wrapper around a group of absence settings that can be linked to a user on `ContractType` level. It basically says which `AbsenceTypes` and `TimeOffBalances` are available for a `ContractType`.

id.description: The unique identifier of the policy.

name.description: A short name for the policy.

description.description: Optional extra description for the policy.

configuration.description: Make absence types available in the policy and possible link time off balances to the absence type.

absenceTypeId.description: The unique identifier of an absence type

balanceIds.description: The unique identifiers of time off balances

percentage.description: Surcharge percentage by which the absence should be recorded

weight.description: Used for ordering the absence types

has_vacation_accrual.description: Leave hours are accrued during the absence

is_counted.description: If set to `false` no hours are calculated for this type, such as leave vacation hours, waiting hours and plus minus hours

has_wait_hours.description: When an absence of this type is requested, wait hours can be specified

leave.description: For each employee total hours are calculated for leave and non-attendance. This value determines in which group the absence type will fall.

color.description: Color of the absence in the schedule. This must be a valid hexadecimal color like \"#FFFFFF\" for white.

icon.description: Icon shown with the absence type

unit.description: When an absence of this type is requested, if it needs to be in days or hours

deleted.description: If the absence type is deleted

roster_action.description:
What to do with the shift in the schedule.

Can only add this field if authorised user has `Approve absentee` or `Approve own absentee` permission

note.description:
Optional text added by the requester to explain more about the absentee.

Only returned if authorised user has `Approve absentee` or `View own absentee` permission.

status.description: Can only be `Approved` or `Declined` if the authorised user `Approve absentee` or `Approve own absentee` permission

AbsenteeDay.description: Absentee details per day in the absence
Absentee details per day in the absence

salary.description: Is `0` if authorised user doesn't have `View salary` or `View own salary` permission.

coc.description:
Cost Of Company

Is `0` if authorised user doesn't have `View salary` or `View own salary` permission.

AbsenteeDay.title: Absentee Day

ApiError.description: The API can return errors for numerous reasons and with different titles / status codes. All errors however have the same model which is based on the JSON API specification. See: https://jsonapi.org/format/#error-objects for more information.

value.title: Missing required property
value.detail: Keyword validation failed: Required property 'some-required-property' must be present in the object

value.title: Property value has invalid format
value.detail: Value 'johnexample.com' does not match format email of type string

status.description: the HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

source.description: an object containing references to the source of the error, optionally including any of the following members

pointer.description: a JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document [e.g. "/data" for a primary data object, or "/data/attributes/title" for a specific attribute].

parameter.description: a string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error.

title.description: a short, human-readable summary of the problem that does not change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem

detail.description: a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

path.description: The path where the file has been stored

model.description: The type of the model where the attachment is linked

export.description: The format of the returned report

columns.description: Specify the desired columns, if empty all available columns are returned

ContractType.title: Contract type
ContractType.description: Every employee in Shiftbase has a contract associated with a contract type. A contract type is a set of rules related to a contract.

id.description: The id of the contract type.

account_id.description: The account ID the contract type is linked to.

plus_min.description: By turning on plus-minus calculation, the plus and minus hours are calculated for all employees with the concerning contract type.

time_off_accrual_source_hours.description:
Specify how the time off balances should be accrued.

- `Contract`: Based on the contract hours
- `Worked`: Based on hours worked
- `None`: No automatic accumulation

salary_calc_type.description: This is used for payroll and indicates whether the employee is paid based on worked or contract hours.

time_off_request_source_hours.description:
Time off determination

- `SCHEDULED`: Based on scheduled hours
- `CONTRACT`: Based on the contract hours
- `NONE`: No time off determination

wait_hours_from.description:
Specify where the waiting hours will be deducted from.

- `SALARY`
- `VACATION`
- `TIME_OFF_BALANCE`

wait_hours_from_time_off_balance_id.description: If the `wait_hours_from` is set to `TIME_OFF_BALANCE` here, you can specify which time off balance the wait hours are deducted from.

rate_card_id.description: The rate card that applies to the contract type.

created.description: The datetime when the contract type has been created.

modified.description: The datetime when the contract type has been modified.

created_by.description: Id of the employee that created the contract type.

modified_by.description: Id of the employee that modified the contract type.

deleted.description: If the contract type is deleted.

overtime_policy_id.description: The overtime policy linked to the contract type.

CustomField.title: CustomField
CustomField.description: Custom Fields allows you to add additional information to employee, timesheets, schedule items, and/or shifts

id.description: The unique identifier for the custom field.

name.description: A name for the custom field. The name must be unique.

type.description:
The value type



- `text`: Free text field where something can be entered.
- `numeric`: Only whole numbers can be entered
- `decimal`: Numbers with decimals after the comma can be entered.
- `money`: Amounts of money can be entered.
- `date`: Dates can be entered.
- `boolean`: A choice can be made between yes and no.
- `select`: A choice can be made between the `select_options`
- `multi-select`: Multiple options can be chosen out of the `select_options`
- `url`: Url field that will be clickable.

applies_to_user.description: The custom field can be applied to an employee

applies_to_timesheet.description: The custom field can be applied to a timesheet

applies_to_shift.description: The custom field can be applied to a shift

applies_to_schedule.description: The custom field can be applied to a schedule

timesheet_copy_starttime.description:
If an employee clocks in later than the given time before the start of her shift, copy the starttime from their shift.

Value is minutes.

timesheet_copy_endtime.description:
If an employee clocks out earlier than the given time after the end of her shift, copy the endtime from their shift.

Value is minutes.

timesheet_copy_schedule.description: Copy schedule to timesheet. Useful when you manually record worked hours

timesheet_interval.description: The interval of minutes you can select in the timesheets and schedule

round_clock_in.description: How the clock in time should be rounded according to the timesheet interval setting

round_clock_out.description: How the clock out time should be rounded according to the timesheet interval setting

approve_clock.description:
`Always`: Always automatically approve.
`RosterMatch`: Approve clock times when start/end times match the employee's schedule
`Never`: Never automatically approve.

allow_clock_in_without_roster.description: Clock always, even if you are not on the schedule.

approve_schedule.description: Automatically approve scheduled hours. Useful if you manually register hours worked.

split_clocked_shifts.description: When a clocked break is longer then the given time in minutes, it should start a new shift.

default_clock_shift.description: When a clock-in action does not match a scheduled shift, it falls back to this Shift ID

reminder_days_before.description: Send reminder for filling in availability x days before start of the week

lock_availability_days_before_period.description: Allow editing of availability until x days before start of the week

required_days_per_week.description: Required amount of available days per week

publish_schedules.description: Publish the schedules given x days ahead of current date

show_open_shifts.description: Show open shift option in schedule

show_required_shifts.description: Show required shift option in schedule

name.description: Employee full name, formatted according to organization name format settings

teamId.description: ID of the team the employee belongs to within the current department

type.description: The employee type within the scope of this department

Employability.title: Employability
Employability.description:
Employability indicates whether an employee can be employed for a specific shift type during a specific period. Based on the permissions of the user requesting the employability details may be omitted from the response, whilst still returning an accurate employable status.

Required permissions:
- Absence conflicts: `View absences`
- Schedule conflicts: `View schedules`
- Availability conflicts: `View availability`
- Skill conflicts: `Create schedules` / `Edit schedules`

employable.description: Indicates whether this employee can be employed or not

details.description: The details (if any) for an employee to be (un)employable for the requested shift

available.description: Indicates wether the availability description leads to an available status within the context of this employability record.

description.description: String representation of the employee's availability record for the start date of the employability info.

absence.description: string representations of any absences related to this employability info request

schedule.description: string representations of any scheduled shifts related to this employability info request

missingSkills.description: string representations of any missing skills related to this employability info request

sequence_id.description: The sequence ID. The ID that all other events are related to as well.

team_id.description: ID of the team within the selected department. This is optional.

date.description: The date when the event takes place

starttime.description: The time when the event starts

endtime.description: The time when the event ends

description.description: Description what the event is about

deleted.description: Determines that the event has been deleted

created.description: The date and time when the event has been created

updated.description: The date and time when the event has been updated

created_by.description: The user ID that created the event

modified_by.description: The user ID that modified the event

start_seconds.description: The date and start time in timestamp

end_seconds.description: The date and end time in timestamp

config.description: Contains the config for the iCal feed. There are three config sections; rosters, events, and absentees.

scope.description: Which schedule items will be included in the feed.

departments.description: List of department ids for which departments schedules to include in the iCal feed

scope.description: Which schedule items will be included in the feed.

departments.description: List of department ids for which departments events to include in the iCal feed

scope.description: Which absentees will be included in the feed

departments.description: List of department ids for which departments absentees to include in the iCal feed

options.description: List of absentees type to include in the iCal feed

status.description: Absentee statuses to include in the iCal feed

last_fetched.description: Date of the last time the iCal feed is fetched

deleted.description: Indicates whether the location has been deactivated/deleted

created.description: The datetime when the location has been created

updated.description: The datetime when the location has been updated

Log.description: The log contains daily information per department such as the turnover and expected turnover as well as the publishing status of a schedule and if timesheets are open for modification.

OpenShift.description:
Open Shift model

### Recurring
The `recurring` property can be set on an OpenShift to make its occurrences repeat. In conjunction, the `interval` can be set to an integer number of weeks to signify the frequency. The `mo`, `tu`, `we`, `th`, `fr`, `sa` and `su` properties can be set to indicate which days will be populated with occurrences. Occurrences will repeat until `repeat_until` (inclusive) or repeat forever if `repeat_until` is `NULL`.

ReportParameters.title: ReportParameters
ReportParameters.description:
The Report parameters model contains all the possible parameters. 

It depends on the report type, which parameters are available, and which parameters are required.

repeat_until.description: When required shift is recurring the date to stop the sequence

tu.description: Whenever the recurring roster occurs on Tuesday

th.description: Whenever the recurring roster occurs on Thursday

fr.description: Whenever the recurring roster occurs on Friday

sa.description: Whenever the recurring roster occurs on Saturday

su.description: Whenever the recurring roster occurs on Sunday

match.description:
- `min`: The minimum number of shifts that must be scheduled.
- `max`: The maximum number of shifts that can be scheduled.
- `exact`: The exact number of shifts to be scheduled.

time_settings.description:
The times that the shifts must adhere to.
- `any`: Start and end time are irrelevant
- `outside`: Start time and end time have to be outside
- `starting`: Has to start at
- `ending`: Has to end at
- `exact`: Start time and end time have to be exactly

API.description:
As an application your requests must contain an `Authorization: {type} {key}` header on every request where `{type}` is `API`. For example: `Authorization: API secretkey123`

This key can be created from within an account, go to: Settings -> App center -> Public API -> Add.

This is a premium feature.
API.name: Authorization

User.name: Authorization
User.description:
As a user your requests must contain an `Authorization: {type} {key}` header on every request where `{type}` is `USER`. For example: `Authorization: USER secretkey123`

This key is generated by doing a login request to `POST /users/login`. The `token` parameter from the response is the api key.
